User Question: I'm on the bus and want to check my bank balance without people seeing my screen. How do I turn the display off while the screen reader keeps talking?
Relevant Note 1: To activate Screen Curtain on iOS and turn off the display triple-tap with three fingers.
Relevant Note 2: You can hide the screen for privacy by selecting Hide Screen in the TalkBack menu.
Relevant Note 3: A three-finger triple tap toggles the Screen Curtain to darken the screen for privacy.

User Question: I have a stack of bills in my wallet. Which apps or tools can help me figure out if I'm holding a $1 or a $20?
Relevant Note 1: The Currency channel in Seeing AI identifies bank notes from various countries.
Relevant Note 2: Cash Reader is an app dedicated specifically to identifying currency from many countries.
Relevant Note 3: US Currency is historically difficult to identify tactually without an app or device.

User Question: I'm on a messy website with JAWS. How do I just get a list of the links so I don't have to tab through everything?
Relevant Note 1: In JAWS the command Insert + F7 brings up a list of all links on the current webpage.
Relevant Note 2: Link Lists allows users to pull up all links on a page (Insert + F7 in JAWS).

User Question: I just received a printed letter in the mail. How can I read it using my phone or computer?
Relevant Note 1: The Document channel in Seeing AI requires you to take a photo and provides audio guidance to align edges.
Relevant Note 2: Lookout's Documents mode helps scan full pages of text on Android.
Relevant Note 3: Insert + Space followed by O then D performs OCR on the current document or image.

User Question: My screen reader is talking too much. What is the quickest way to make it stop speaking instantly?
Relevant Note 1: To silence JAWS speech immediately press the Control key.
Relevant Note 2: To stop Narrator from reading continuously press the Control key.
Relevant Note 3: To stop VoiceOver from speaking immediately perform a two-finger single tap.

User Question: I want to skim a news article by jumping from headline to headline. What key should I press?
Relevant Note 1: The H key acts as the shortcut for Headings in most major screen readers (JAWS NVDA VoiceOver).
Relevant Note 2: To list all headings on a webpage in JAWS press Insert + F6.

User Question: I dropped my earring and can't find it. Is there an app that lets me video call a sighted person to help me look?
Relevant Note 1: Be My Eyes connects blind users to sighted volunteers via video call.
Relevant Note 2: Aira provides on-demand access to professional visual interpreters for a subscription fee.

User Question: I need to know what time it is, but I don't want to minimize my current window. Is there a shortcut?
Relevant Note 1: To read the current time in JAWS press Insert + F12.
Relevant Note 2: NVDA + F12 allows you to hear the time.
Relevant Note 3: Talking watches press a button to announce the time audibly.

User Question: I want to type faster on my phone using Braille input. How does that work?
Relevant Note 1: Braille Screen Input on iOS allows you to calibrate dot positions based on where your fingers land.
Relevant Note 2: TalkBack supports a braille keyboard that allows typing directly on the screen.
Relevant Note 3: In Braille Screen Input swiping right adds a space.

User Question: I'm walking to a new coffee shop. What app can give me audio cues about the intersections I'm passing?
Relevant Note 1: BlindSquare is a GPS app that announces points of interest and intersections.
Relevant Note 2: Soundscape (and its community successors) uses 3D audio to place sounds virtually in space for navigation.
Relevant Note 3: Lazarillo is a GPS app that focuses on accessible routing and indoor navigation in some venues.

User Question: I have low vision and just want to zoom in on my PC screen. What is the keyboard shortcut to turn on the magnifier?
Relevant Note 1: Windows Key + Plus turns on Magnifier and zooms in.
Relevant Note 2: Windows Key + Esc closes Windows Magnifier.

User Question: I'm holding a can of soup but I don't know what flavor it is. How can I find out?
Relevant Note 1: Lookout's Food Label mode scans barcodes to identify packaged grocery items.
Relevant Note 2: The Short Text channel in Seeing AI reads text as soon as it appears in the camera frame.

User Question: I'm using an Android phone and need to change my reading settings. How do I open the main TalkBack menu?
Relevant Note 1: The TalkBack menu is accessed by a three-finger tap or an L-shaped gesture (swipe down then right).
Relevant Note 2: To read from the top open the TalkBack menu and select Read from top.

User Question: I want to listen to a book from the NLS library. What app or device should I use?
Relevant Note 1: Bard Mobile allows users to download audiobooks from the NLS Braille and Audio Reading Download service.
Relevant Note 2: Victor Reader Stream is a handheld media player for blind users with tactile buttons.
Relevant Note 3: Digital talking book players are hardware devices specifically for playing NLS books.

User Question: I have too many apps open. How do I switch between them using my screen reader?
Relevant Note 1: To switch between open applications with JAWS speech support use Alt + Tab.
Relevant Note 2: To access the App Switcher swipe up from the bottom and hold until a second vibration is felt.
Relevant Note 3: Use a single-finger swipe left then right to open the Recent Apps overview (button navigation).

User Question: I'm trying to learn a Mac. How do I turn the screen reader on and what are the modifier keys?
Relevant Note 1: Command + F5 toggles VoiceOver on macOS.
Relevant Note 2: The VoiceOver keys (VO keys) are Control + Option.

User Question: I'm sorting laundry. How do I tell if this shirt is red or blue?
Relevant Note 1: The Color channel in Seeing AI identifies the color of the object in the center of the frame.
Relevant Note 2: Color identifiers are small devices that speak the color of the object they are touched to.

User Question: I'm reading a financial chart on a website. How do I move through the cells?
Relevant Note 1: Table navigation in JAWS uses Alt + Ctrl + Arrow Keys to move between cells.
Relevant Note 2: T is the shortcut key to jump to the next table in JAWS and NVDA.
Relevant Note 3: Tables should have column headers (th) defined so screen readers can associate data cells with headers.

User Question: I want to scroll through text on my Braille display without taking my hands off it. Which keys do I use?
Relevant Note 1: Panning buttons are used to scroll the braille display to the next section of text.
Relevant Note 2: Cursor Routing buttons are located above each cell on a display to move the cursor to that specific character.

User Question: My screen reader is acting glitchy. How do I turn it off or restart it quickly?
Relevant Note 1: To quit NVDA completely press NVDA + Q.
Relevant Note 2: Caps Lock + Esc exits Narrator.
Relevant Note 3: To turn VoiceOver on or off use Siri and say Turn on VoiceOver.
